bug.author: katzenbaer
bug.summary: TensorFlow for Poets: Section 5: Missing a verb
bug.description: In <denchmark-link:https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/index.html?index=..%2F..%2Findex#4>https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/index.html?index=..%2F..%2Findex#4</denchmark-link> , "You might warnings" is missing a verb. Maybe "You might get warnings" or "You might see warnings"?

comments.comment: Also "they not harmful" might need a verb too...
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wolffg>@wolffg</denchmark-link> If this is poetry, does it really need to be grammatically correct?
No, the user is the poet; the codelab is not, so we should probably fix the grammar.
This is fixed. Next codelab could be: TensorFlow poetry - RNNs
